name: Butternut Squash Soup
ingredients: 2 Medium Butternut Squash-­‐cut in half & seeded 1 C heavy whipping cream
1 onion (the sweetest available) 2 Cups chicken or Turkey Broth
2 apples (Fuji-­‐if avalible)-­‐peeled and diced 1/2 C Smuckers Simply Fruit-­‐Apricot (Spreadable Fruit)
1 pear-­‐ peeled and cored and diced 1/2 C honey or 1/4 C brown sugar
steps: Heat oven to 350. Lightly oil Butternut Squash with 2 Tbsp of veg. oil and place on baking sheet. Roast uncovered
Add diced pear, roasted squash, chicken broth, apricot jam and fresh ground nutmeg. Bring to a simmer
for approx. 30 minutes until tender. Using spoon remove flesh from squash. In large soup pot heat butter over Add
diced pear, roasted squash, chicken broth, apricot jam and fresh ground nutmeg. Bring to a simmer and allow to simmer
for 15 min. to allow for interchange of flavors. Just before serving, add whipping cream and blend until completely
smooth and frothy. ( I get the best results with a hand blender, the stick kind)
(Add salt and pepper and honey or brown sugar as needed to taste)
